definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: She trusts you that you will hold her anyways when she is falling back.
sentences.chinese: 她相信在任何时候，当她要摔倒时，你都会扯住她。

sentences.english: Hadley abruptly jerks Andy to a stop right at the edge.
sentences.chinese: 哈雷猛得在房顶边扯住安迪。

sentences.english: Just stretch the sleeves over your hand, and no one will notice .
sentences.chinese: 你用手扯住袖子好了，没人会注意到的。

sentences.english: Stretch hand to pull her arm go toward a car appearance Ye.
sentences.chinese: 伸手扯住她的胳膊往车外面拽。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
corner of the lower hem of a jacket etc
to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
with a lightning move of the hand
to shout at sb to stop
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
